solution_03_central_limit_theorem/02_normal/02_leftarea_from_x_v2

video (using z-table)

video (using app): the app

First, draw a sketch. We can label the \(H\) axis by adding integer multiples of 1 to 18. We know to shade toward the left because small values of \(H\) satisfy the condition \(H<17\).


We are given a specific \(h\) value as a boundary. (Remember, for random variables we use uppercase letters, but for specific values we use lowercase.) \[h = 17 \] We calculate the \(z\) value of the boundary. \[\begin{aligned} z &= \frac{h-\mu}{\sigma} \\\\ &= \frac{17-18}{1} \\\\ &= -1 \end{aligned}\]

We have rephrased our problem into a standard normal probability problem, because \[P(H<17) ~=~ P(Z<-1) \]

So, we just need to evaluate \(P(Z<-1)\). To do this, you just need a \(z\)-table.

\(z\) \(P(Z<z)\)
-1.02 0.1539
-1.01 0.1562
-1 0.1587
-0.99 0.1611
-0.98 0.1635

Thus, we find our answer. \[P(H<17) = 0.1587 \]
